moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Just look at him he's guilty? Seriously?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: What if I look at him and I see he's not guilty? Where do you get off judging people like that?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: In fact, I happen to know the defendant. So if we're going on moral character here, I'm the only person in this room who should have an opinion on the matter.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I can judge whomever I please! Hell, you know him so well. Why don't you tell me about him? Does he have a job or is he another unemployed deadbeat?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Last I heard he's still working 9 to 5 at Iniref. Well, he was working there before he was indicted on certain charges.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Well I'll bet he's never been to church! Godless as his acts, he'd probably catch fire if he walked past the threshold.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: How do you not know that? Wouldn't you have seen him there at some point?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I actually haven't been getting down there lately.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I'm, uh, worshipping him from home, you see.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I really should get down there more.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: And you feel it right to judge a man for not going to church when you don't even go yourself?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Well if the man is as god fearing as you say...
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Perhaps I judged him too harshly.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: It takes a big man to admit he's wrong. Good on ya, pops.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: eddie

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: And hopefully we can move forward based on the facts, rather than the fancy.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: clive

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Lets move on, shall we? We haven't got all day here!
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

murderIsUncool.text: I don't think it was very "cool" for the victim.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne

murderIsUncool.text: Oh, I didn't mean it like that!
murderIsUncool.speaker: kylie

murderIsUncool.text: Not like it was cool that a lady got murdered, just that a murder trial is more interesting for the jurors.
murderIsUncool.speaker: kylie

murderIsUncool.text: I'm sure you didn't. But it still sounded disrespectful.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne

murderIsUncool.text: C'mon, it's just some poor wording. It's no big deal.
murderIsUncool.speaker: mason

murderIsUncool.text: This isn't entertainment. A woman is dead and we hold this man's fate in our hands. We must take it seriously.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne
